abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial. Nonetheless, lessons
            reinforce the need for Government commitments at all levels,
            to succeed in the implementation of sectoral reforms. In
            this case, key aspects of educational reforms, should have
            been framed in the broader context of a civil service
            reform, to achieve the desired reforms in organization, and
            management of the Ministry of Education. Furthermore, the
            lack of coordination between the Ministries of Finance, and
            of Education, prevented construction of a new building for
            the education ministry, determined as key to achieving the
            ministry's management strengthening. Despite initial
            consultations with stakeholders, disappointment was
            expressed on project design, and objectives, leading to
            unfulfilled expectations on its final outcome. The project
            thus failed to incorporate stakeholders' inputs;
            therefore, improved dialogue with stakeholders during
            implementation, would also strengthen ownership, and
            overcome difficulties (such as teacher union position on
            adjustment of teacher/student ratios). Moreover, project
            design would have better succeed, had the design of
            infrastructure works - assigned to a renowned architectural
            firm, but proven not sufficient - been prepared at an early
            stage, allowing time to adjust considerable aspects during
            implementation, and reduce cost overruns.
